p: Of the many plants which have important antiviral activity, those used most frequently in Jamaica for the common cold and influenza viruses are: Cerassee ( Momordic charactia L.), and Fevergrass ( Cymbopogon citratus L.), Tamarind leaves ( Tamarindus indica L.) , Thyme ( Thymus vulgaris L.) , Sarsaparilla ( Smilax ornata Lem.), Soursop leaf ( Annona muricate L.) , Pimento Leaf ( Pimenta dioca (L.) Merr.), Garlic ( Allium sativum L.), Leaf of Life ( Bryophyllum pinnatum (Lam.) Oken), Search-mi-heart ( Rhytidophyllum tomentosum (L. Mart.), Mint ( Mentha piperita L.), Cinnamon ( Cinnamomum verum J. Presl), Oregano ( Oregano vulgare L.), Papaya leaf ( Carica papaya L.), and Medina ( Alysicarpus vaginalis (L.) DC.). Some Jamaican plants with major antiviral activity are shown in Figure 1 and are discussed below.
